messages.message: I’m still seeing this issue btw since this is on aihub uat I’m concerned it will affect next weeks prod push

this did not occur in my pre-existing empty Converse project

this only occurs if you create a new Converse project and click “select files” to upload a file - i was able to reproduce this way
actually this isn’t accurate, i tried this a second time and couldn’t reproduce :lolcry:

somehow, if i have the browser console open, the issue doesn’t occur

if i close the browser console and click “select files”, i’m able to reproduce :confused_dog:
hm, as you can see in the above video I did reproduce w the browser console open
yeah i know, but it always works for me with the browser console open
do you want to hop on a call to debug if you can consistently reproduce?
actually does 4:30pm ET work for a debugging call?

so did some testing and setting `refetchOnWindowFocus` to `false` in the `useInitialDigitizationStatus` query seems to fix this issue. IIRC @Jessica made that change recently to globally set `refetchOnWindowFocus` to `true`. I’m not familiar enough with the code here to know if the solution should be just setting `refetchOnWindowFocus:false` or if there’s a more preferable solution
Ooh interesting this is the first bug we've found from this! So it must be because the file picker is open, selecting something triggers a refocus on the window?
I bet it's because of the cancleQueries function being called on line 483

This seems like something that would benefit from keeping `refetchOnWindowFocus` set to true, but I'm also not familiar enough with this to fix it quickly. @Subash it looks like you touched this code most recently - do you want to try to fix this bug or should we turn off refetching for this query?
